sub_topic: The construction of the Hilbert curve.
message_1: What is the area enclosed by a Hilbert curve of order 5 if the length of each side of the largest square is 1 unit?
message_2:
A Hilbert curve is a continuous fractal space-filling curve that fills the entire area of a square. The area enclosed by a Hilbert curve of any order within a square is equal to the area of the square itself.

In this case, the largest square has a side length of 1 unit. The area of a square is calculated using the formula:

Area = side_length × side_length

So, the area enclosed by a Hilbert curve of order 5 within a square of side length 1 unit is:

Area = 1 × 1 = 1 square unit
